triples.name: Fuzzy control system
triples.relevance: The paper uses interval type-2 fuzzy systems to model and control the nonlinear multi-agent systems with parameter uncertainties.

triples.name: Type-2 fuzzy sets and systems
triples.relevance: Interval type-2 fuzzy systems are specifically used in the paper to handle uncertainties and parameter variations in the MAS modeling.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The core subject of the paper is achieving consensus control in nonlinear multi-agent systems with parameter uncertainties.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a dynamic event-triggered fuzzy controller to solve the fuzzy consensus problem for nonlinear MASs.

triples.name: Lyapunov stability
triples.relevance: The paper uses Lyapunov-Krasovskii functional methods to analyze and guarantee stability of the proposed control scheme.

triples.name: Exponential stability
triples.relevance: The paper guarantees that all agents achieve exponential consensus, providing a quantified rate of convergence.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: The paper addresses control of nonlinear multi-agent systems through fuzzy-based dynamic event-triggered mechanisms.

triples.name: Tunnel diode
triples.relevance: A tunnel diode circuit is used as one of the practical applications to verify the efficiency of the proposed control method.

triples.name: Robotic arm
triples.relevance: A one-link manipulator (robotic arm) system is used as another practical application example to demonstrate the control method.
